Reason: The _journalDiskSync configuration option is performance-sensitive because it directly affects system performance at the system level. Enabling disk synchronization can introduce performance overhead due to the synchronization process, leading to notable performance variations. The triggering frequency of the configuration also plays a role in its performance impact, as frequent calls to the journal() method will trigger the configuration more often, further impacting performance. Additionally, the size impact of the configuration is significant, with potential trade-offs between data durability and performance. Therefore, based on the code context and developer information, the _journalDiskSync configuration is classified as performance-sensitive.
